trial_identification.studytitle: Verify the effect of the treadmill intervention on the motor development of high risk babies
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Verify the effect of the treadmill intervention on the motor development of high risk babies

conditions.healthcondition: motor development in high risk babies

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Normal musculoskeletal and cartilage development and function

interventions.interventions: Treadmill intervention twice times a week, belt speed 0.28 m/s, 8 minutes a day, until babies are able to walk independently, after physical therapy session of precocial stimulation of motor development that consists of sensory-motor stimulation by 45 minutes also twice times a week, until babies are able to walk independently.
interventions.comparator: High Risk Babies Group without treadmill intervention

primaryOutcome.timepoint: assessed during interventions months by Alberta Infant Motor Scale - AIMS, since the first month of intervention until the age of walking independent onset

primaryOutcome.outcome: type and quantity of babies steps in the treadmill film for 2 minutes during intervention sessions (alternate, parallel, single, double)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: assessed during interventions months by film, since the first month of intervention until the age of walking independent onset

secondaryOutcome.outcome: age of others milestones (roling, sit alone, crawling and standing alone)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: assessed during interventions months by Alberta Infant Motor Scale - AIMS, since the first month of intervention until the age of walking independent onset

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: high risk babies (prematurity, low birth weight, sepsis, meningitis, resuscitation, high-frequency ventilation, total parenteral nutrition, prolonged oxygen requirements, intraventricular and periventricular hemorrhage levels I and II, seizures)
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Abnormal neurologic exam at discharge, congenital abnormalities

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Purpose: Investigate the effects of treadmill interventions in high risk babies motor development Hypothesis: 1. The experimental group will acquire the independent walking earlier than the high risk babies control group 2. The experimental group will acquire the others milestones earlier than the high risk babies control group 3. The alternative steps will increase along the intervention months
ethicsAndSummary.publication: 1. I Encontro Paulista de Comportamento Motor, May 2009, Sao Paulo, SP, Brazil 2. XX Congresso Nacional da ABENEPI, June 2009, Campinas, SP, Brazil
